notesStmt.note: On folio 119v there is a beginning of a question and answer on a grammatical matter in the Song of Songs.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: The commentary of Japheth ben Ali ha-Levi on the Song of Songs (fragments).

msItem.title: Perush Shir ha-shirim פרוש שיר השירים

collation.p: 16 quires, originally of 10 leaves each (except the last which has 8 leaves). First 2 quires are lost, 3-5 are imperfect. The quires are signed with Hebrew letters and Arabic words on the upper margin of the first page.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Square and semi-cursive script of the 15th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Spine: 'Yefet. Comm. on Canticles. Arabic. Brit. Mus. Oriental 2514.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Moses Wilhelm Shapira (b. 1830, d. 1884), an antiquities dealer of Jerusalem: purchased by the British Library from him on 08 July 1882, folio [120v].
